title: إِعْمَال الْمَصْدَر
titleEn: The Masdar Acting as a Verb
description: Learn how the masdar (verbal noun) can act like its verb, taking objects and completing verbal meaning.

notes.title: The Masdar's Verbal Action
content: The masdar (verbal noun) can govern like its verb, taking a direct object in the accusative case.
For example: عَجِبْتُ مِنْ ضَرْبِكَ زَيْدًا (I was amazed at your hitting Zaid). Here ضَرْب takes زَيْدًا as its object.
keyPoints: Masdar can take objects like its verb
Often preceded by preposition: مِنْ ضَرْبِكَ زَيْدًا
The subject can be expressed through إضافة or ل

examples.english: I was amazed at your hitting Zaid
Your reading the Quran pleased me
His memorizing the lesson impressed me
I was happy at your passing the exam

notes.title: Structure with Subject and Object
content: When the masdar has both a subject and object, the subject typically comes in إضافة, and the object takes accusative.
Alternative: Subject with ل and object in إضافة: سَرَّنِي قِرَاءَتُهُ لِلْكِتَابِ.
keyPoints: Subject in إضافة + object accusative: قِرَاءَتُكَ الْكِتَابَ
Subject with لِـ + object in إضافة: قِرَاءَةُ الْكِتَابِ لَكَ
Both subject and object can be pronouns
Masdar retains meaning of its root verb

examples.english: Your honoring the guest pleased me
I was amazed at his love of money
I regretted my abandoning the prayer

exercises.promptEn: I was amazed at your _____ Zaid

exercises.prompt: Your honoring the guest pleased me
I was happy at your passing the exam
